intro: Tylostemon obscurus, commonly known as the dark tylostemon, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Tylostemon obscurus is often found in shrubland and heath communities, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
